00022 /*
00023  * Written by Lloyd Hilaiel, on or around Fri May 18 17:06:54 MDT 2007 
00024  *
00025  * Types.  These basic types are how arguments are passed to services,
00026  * and how responses are returned from services.  The representation
00027  * allows introspection which allows data to be serialized or bound to
00028  * native types in different target execution environments.
00029  */
00030 
00031 #ifndef __BPTYPES_H__
00032 #define __BPTYPES_H__
00033 
00034 #ifdef __cplusplus
00035 extern "C" {
00036 #endif    
00037 
00042 typedef enum {
00043     BPTNull,    
00044     BPTBoolean, 
00045     BPTInteger, 
00046     BPTDouble,  
00047     BPTString,  
00048     BPTMap,     
00049     BPTList,    
00050     BPTCallBack,
00051     BPTPath,    
00054     BPTAny      
00056 } BPType;
00057 
00058 /* definition of basic types */
00059 
00061 typedef int BPBool;
00063 #define BP_TRUE 1
00064 
00065 #define BP_FALSE 0
00066 
00067 typedef char * BPString;
00069 typedef long long int BPInteger;        
00071 typedef double BPDouble;        
00072 
00074 typedef BPInteger BPCallBack;        
00075 
00077 typedef struct {
00079     unsigned int size;
00081     struct BPElement_t ** elements;
00082 } BPList;
00083 
00085 typedef struct {
00087     unsigned int size;
00089     struct BPMapElem_t * elements;
00090 } BPMap;
00091 
00093 typedef char * BPPath;
00094 
00096 typedef struct BPElement_t {
00099     BPType type;
00101     union 
00102     {
00103         BPBool booleanVal;
00104         BPString stringVal;
00105         BPInteger integerVal;        
00106         BPDouble doubleVal;        
00107         BPMap mapVal;
00108         BPList listVal;
00109         BPCallBack callbackVal;
00110         BPPath pathVal;
00111     } value;
00112 } BPElement;
00113 
00116 typedef struct BPMapElem_t {
00117     BPString key;        
00118     BPElement * value;
00119 } BPMapElem;

00121 #ifdef __cplusplus
00122 };
